title: Project setup: Initialize Bun + TypeScript project
description: Initialize the project with Bun and TypeScript. Set up tsconfig.json, package.json with proper scripts, and directory structure (src/, tests/, etc.). This is the foundation for all other work.

title: Implement selection caching (co-occurrence bundles)
description: Remember which tools are frequently used together. Creates co-occurrence bundles to improve tool suggestions based on usage patterns.
close_reason: Implemented selection caching with co-occurrence tracking. See commit 8f6279a.

title: [EPIC] v0.3: Implement selection caching and detail levels (L0-L2)
close_reason: v0.3 complete: Detail levels (L0/L1/L2) and selection caching both implemented.

title: Design: Namespacing strategy for tools with identical names from different servers
description: Open question: How to handle tools with identical names from different servers? Need to design and implement a namespacing strategy to disambiguate.
close_reason: Implemented tool namespacing with serverKey:toolName format, ambiguity detection, and conflict logging

title: Increase test coverage to 85%+
description:
Current coverage: 72% functions, 71% lines. Key gaps to address:

1. **Server handlers** (src/server/index.ts - 44% lines): Add integration tests for find_tools, describe_tools, execute meta-tools
2. **Embeddings generator** (src/embeddings/generator.ts - 6% lines): Add tests for embedding generation and similarity
3. **Retriever** (src/retriever/retriever.ts - 71% lines): Cover semantic/hybrid search modes, embedding sync
4. **Config loading** (src/config/load.ts - 59% lines): Cover migration paths, error cases
5. **CLI entry point** (src/index.ts - 20% lines): Test command dispatch

Skip TUI (src/tui/config.ts) - interactive UI testing is lower priority.

description: Non-functional requirement: Meta-server process should use less than 100MB RAM. Requires efficient data structures and memory management.
close_reason: Implemented in this session: security filtering in find_tools/describe_tools, background index refresh with change detection, latency benchmarks (<1ms for 1000 tools), memory profiling (fast mode <100MB)

title: [EPIC] v0.2: Support multiple upstream servers and hybrid search
close_reason: Dependencies complete: MVP and search modes implemented

description: Add mode parameter to find_tools API: 'fast' (FTS5 only, default), 'semantic' (vector similarity), 'hybrid' (FTS5 + rerank with embeddings). Update config schema to allow default mode selection. Ensure backward compatibility - mode defaults to 'fast'.
close_reason: Implemented search mode parameter (fast/semantic/hybrid) in Retriever.search() and find_tools API. Added 9 new tests for search modes. Semantic and hybrid modes fall back to fast when embeddings aren't initialized.

title: Implement change detection for upstream tool updates
description: Poll or listen for changes in upstream MCP server tools and update the local index accordingly. Addresses Context Rot problem.
close_reason: Implemented in this session: security filtering in find_tools/describe_tools, background index refresh with change detection, latency benchmarks (<1ms for 1000 tools), memory profiling (fast mode <100MB)

title: Implement list_namespaces API: list_namespaces() -> List[string]
description: Optional public MCP-facing API that lists available namespaces. Helps with tool disambiguation when multiple servers have same-named tools.

title: Implement find_tools API: find_tools(query, limit) -> List[ToolSummary]
description: Public MCP-facing API that searches for tools by query string. Returns list of tool summaries with configurable limit (default 5). Core discovery mechanism for clients.

title: Storage: Add vector embeddings to SQLite index
description: Extend IndexStore to support vector embeddings for semantic search. Options: 1) sqlite-vec extension for native vector ops, 2) Store as BLOB and compute similarity in JS. Need to store 384-dim float32 vectors (~1.5KB per tool). Consider indexing strategy for fast similarity search.
close_reason: Vector storage implemented using BLOB + JS cosine similarity. Added: updateEmbedding, updateEmbeddings, searchSemantic, getEmbeddingCount, getToolsWithoutEmbeddings, clearEmbeddings. All 11 tests pass.

title: Research: Optimal strategy for local embedding generation
description: Open question: What is the optimal strategy for local embedding generation? Need to balance performance vs quality for semantic search capabilities.

title: Implement Composer: Construct detail levels (L0-L2) for responses
description: Constructs appropriate detail level for responses: L0 (Name Only), L1 (Summary: Description + simplified signature), L2 (Full Schema: complete JSON schema for execution).
close_reason: Implemented detail levels L0/L1/L2 in find_tools API. See commit 9dddc45.

title: Prototype: Test Transformers.js + WASM embeddings in Bun
description: Test embedding generation with Transformers.js using WASM backend in Bun runtime. Validate: 1) BGE-small-en-v1.5 (q8) model loads correctly, 2) Inference latency <50ms on CPU, 3) WASM backend works without native bindings. This validates the technical approach before full integration.
close_reason: Prototype successful: WASM embeddings work in Bun with 3.1ms avg latency (target <50ms). BGE-small-en-v1.5 (q8) produces quality embeddings.

comments.text:
## Prototype Results

**Test Date:** 2026-01-10

### Latency
- Average: 3.1ms (target: <50ms) âœ“
- First query: 7.5ms (warm-up)
- Subsequent: 1.4-1.8ms
- Batch: 0.8ms/query

### Quality
- Similarity ranking correct
- "file reading tools" vs "Read files from disk": 0.772
- "file reading tools" vs "Send email notifications": 0.440

### Resources
- Model: Xenova/bge-small-en-v1.5 (q8)
- Dimensions: 384
- Model load: ~3.2s first run (~33MB download)
- Memory (RSS): 294MB

### Files Created
- src/embeddings/index.ts
- src/embeddings/generator.ts
- scripts/test-embeddings.ts

### Conclusion
WASM backend works perfectly in Bun. Latency is excellent. Memory is higher than ideal but acceptable for optional semantic mode.

title: Security: Implement tool allowlists
description: Allow users to configure which tools are exposed to the LLM. Supports security-conscious users who want to control tool access.
close_reason: Implemented in this session: security filtering in find_tools/describe_tools, background index refresh with change detection, latency benchmarks (<1ms for 1000 tools), memory profiling (fast mode <100MB)

title: Implement Index: Local vector/keyword store for tool definitions
description: Local storage using SQLite + FTS + local embedding model. Stores servers, tools, and embeddings. Data model: servers {id, name, transport_config, status}, tools {id, server_id, name, description, schema_hash, last_updated}, embeddings {tool_id, vector}.
close_reason: Implemented IndexStore with SQLite + FTS5 for tool storage and full-text search
